availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jonathan P. Ferguson (Logan County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Logan County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Ferguson. Father of William Ferguson, Margaret Ferguson, Nancy Ferguson, and James Ferguson. Owned five enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Logan County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850),Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 1, p. 323. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 1, p. 52. Find A Grave, "Jonathan P. Ferguson (1813-1869)," Memorial #82802470, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/82802470/jonathan-p-ferguson (accessed May 28, 2017).
